p:
The validity of the built model should be tested on an external set of data that has not yet been used during the process of developing the model (Tropsha et al. 2003). The built equations were evaluated using the Friedman formula; (Friedman 1991).
\documentclass[12pt]{minimal} \usepackage{amsmath} \usepackage{wasysym} \usepackage{amsfonts} \usepackage{amssymb} \usepackage{amsbsy} \usepackage{mathrsfs} \usepackage{upgreek} \setlength{\oddsidemargin}{-69pt} \begin{document}$$ \mathrm{LOF}=\kern0.5em \frac{SEE}{M{\left[1-\beta \left(\frac{c+d\times p}{M}\right)\right]}^2} $$\end{document}
